definition: The issue is in the past, and the situation has changed (idiom)./It is water under the bridge.
matter/thing/item/work/affair/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1],回[hui2]
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
(experienced action marker)
border/place/condition/boundary/circumstances/territory
to move/to shift/to change (a position or location etc)/to promote

sentences.english: Things change and friends leave. And life doesn't stop for anybody.
sentences.chinese: 事过境迁，物是人非，不因任何人停留。

sentences.english: The whole matter is dead and buried and I don't want you to mention it again.
sentences.chinese: 整件事已经事过境迁了，我不希望你再提起来。

sentences.english: But times have changed, and the Web is now big business.
sentences.chinese: 事过境迁，现在的互联网业已是一个新形的产业。

sentences.english: During the interview, she revealed that she cried her heart out every night when she was alone.
sentences.chinese: 事过境迁，她接受专访时透露其实在人后却哭成泪人。

sentences.english: I don't want you to mention it again.
sentences.chinese: 整件事已经事过境迁了，我不希望你再提起来。

sentences.english: Don't cry because it's over now, laugh because it happened.
sentences.chinese: 别为事过境迁而哭泣，要为曾经拥有而高兴。

definition: things change with the passage of time (idiom)
things have remained the same, but people have changed
the past is dead (idiom)
old affair/former matter
to release (tension)/relief (from suspense)/to dispel (usu. with negative, unable to forget)
ephemeral (idiom)
to be forgotten/to fade from memory
ephemeral (idiom)
to raise the same old topic again/to hark back
lit. the blue sea turned into mulberry fields (idiom)/fig. the transformations of the world
to be estranged
the past/impurity contracted previously (in the sentient world) (Buddhism)
lit. having crossed the vast ocean (idiom)/fig. widely experienced in the vicissitudes of life
spilt water is difficult to retrieve (idiom)/it's no use crying over spilt milk/what's done is done and can't be reversed/the damage is done/once divorced, there's no reuniting
past events/former happenings
affairs of life/things of the world
